text: Welcome to how to cook that I am Ann Reardon

Today hello kitty has made it to the top of
the cake request list ... with just a few

of you asking for a hello kitty cake
All right here we go

You're going to need one quantity of italian
meringue frosting because it is brilliant

white and it's light and it's fluffy it is
just the perfect frosting for this cake.

If you haven't made that before there is video
recipe showing how to do that just click on

the link in the description below this video
to go to howtocookthat.net and all the recipe

quantities and the video explaining how to
make it is there for you.

You will also find the cake sized hello kitty
template there.

So print that out, cut one of the sheets through
the nose and bow and use that to line it up

with the second sheet and sticky tape it into
place.

Then cut out the face completely and this
is going to be our guide for how big to make
details and exactly where to place them.

You are also going to need two 20cm cakes,
you can use vanilla, chocolate, red velvet
whatever your favourite cake is.

Take one of the cakes and place the cheek
of the kitty against the edge of the cake

and make note where the nose is because that
is the central point of the face and cut the
cake straight down at that point.

Take your second cake, put it under the first
one and cut it to exactly the same size.

turn it around, join them together and you
will have the right width for your cake.

Then out your template over the top and using
that as a guide trim off a small amount, just

a tiny bit at the top and bottom just to straighten
up the middle edge there.

Next use one of your off cut pieces to cut
two ears, again use your template as your

cutting guide and then you're going to need
to round off the lower edge of the ear so
that it fits snuggly against the round cake.

Put them in place and then use your template
to cut around again and get it exactly right.

The simpler a cake design looks the more exact
it needs to be to make it look good.

Trim your ears to the same height as the height
of the cake by slicing some off the bottom
of the ear.

And then you can put your ears to one side
for now.

And slice through the cake in the centre so
it gives you two layers.

Put a smear of italian meringue on your cake
board to stop the cake from moving around
and put your bottom layer in place.

Now I am adding a thin layer of strawberry
jam between the layers, you can use lemon
curd or any other filling of your choice.

Then add the top layer of cake and clear away
any crumbs so they don't get stuck in your
frosting.

Pile some of your italian meringue on top
of the cake and spread it out over the top
using a spatula or a palette knife.

Then spread it down and around so that you
cover all the sides get more frosting out

of the bowl if you need it you've got plenty
there just make sure you keep a little bit
because we will need some later.

Then using a flexible piece of plastic smooth
off the cake.

If you go to a stationary store you will find
plastic folders or document pockets there
that you can cut up and use for this purpose.
Then use a pallette knife to smooth the edges.

Now for the messy bit, take one ear at a time
and cover it in frosting on the base and the
sides.

Put it into place and then use your spatula
smooth cover the top and smooth the sides

of the ears to give the slightly pointy kitty
ears shape.

To make your whiskers take some licorice and
cut it thinner and use the template that we've
got to measure the length of each whisker.

Cut a longer thin strip of licorice and use
it to outline the face.

Now if you don't have any licorice that is
long in a roll like this in stores near you

or if you don't like licorice you can always
use black fondant for this just roll it out
thinly into a long snake and outline it.

Because it is a cartoon character they always
look better outlined because that's how they
are drawn.

Then hold your template above your cake, now
don't touch the cake or the icing with the

template just hover it over the cake and hold
your whisker in position, then move the template
and put the whisker down in place.
And repeat that on the other side.

This will just help you get it exactly how
it is on the drawing so that it looks like
hello kitty.

Make an oval nose out of the licorice for
the nose and again use your template as a
guide of where to place it on the cake.

Cut the two eyes out of licorice again you
can use fondant if you'd rather and then place
them on the cake in exactly the right spot.

To make you bow you're going to need two 60g
balls of fondant and one 20g ball of fondant

in the colour of your choice, most often you'll
see it in red or pink.

Take one of the larger balls and squash one
end of it between your palms just as shown.

And then put it on your template and flatten
it with one hand while supporting the top

edge of it with the other hand so that you're
keeping it within the shape of the template.

Repeat that for the other side to the bow,
squash it and then flatten it and then keep
it in the shape of the template.

Next take a teaspoon and make an indent on
each side of the bow, just like you'll see
on the picture of hello kitty.

And then take your 20 grams of fondant and
roll it into a nice neat ball, place it in

the centre and flatten it slightly to get
it to the right size using the palm of your
hand.

Gently pick up your bow and place it on your
kitty.

You're nearly done just
take a small amount of italian meringue and

mix it with some yellow colouring, put it
in a ziplock bag, twist the top of the bag,

cut off the very corner Then hold it low in
the centre of the nose and pipe frosting in

to fill the nose and you might need to use
your finder to smooth it off.
It's kitty.

Next week we have a dessert video and then
following week is chocolate so if you haven't

already put your chocolate truffle filling
requests in yet make sure you do that this

week and put your dessert and cake requests
below.

I'll see you soon thanks for watching, Bye
[music by youtube.com/setsailtv The Boat Song
used with permission]
